title: Change equilibrium position to increase CO2

content.description:
A sample of <math alttext="M g C O 3 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MgCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed in a previously evacuated rigid container. The temperature is raised to <math alttext="250 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>250</mn> <mi>°</mi> <mtext>C</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, and the reaction represented by the following equation reaches equilibrium with both solids present in the container.

<math alttext="M g C O 3 solid is in equilibrium with M g O solid, plus C O 2 gas. delta H naught, equals 100 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>MgCO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>(</mtext> <mi>s</mi> <mtext>)</mtext> <mo>⇄</mo> <mtext>MgO(</mtext> <mi>s</mi> <mtext>)</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext>(</mtext> <mi>g</mi> <mtext>)</mtext> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="3.0em"> </mspace> <mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi> <mi>H</mi> <mi>°</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>100</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>kJ/mol</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mi>n</mi> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
content.question: Which of the following adjustments to the system will increase the number of moles of <math alttext="C O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> at equilibrium?

choices.label: Raising the temperature of the system to <math alttext="300 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
Lowering the temperature of the system to <math alttext="200 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
Adding <math alttext="M g O solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MgO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to the system

Adding <math alttext="M g C O 3 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MgCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to the system

content.answer: Raising the temperature of the system to <math alttext="300 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
